instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, no power,no charge liquid damage
threads.message: I am newb.  Have Microscope,US cleaner and getting Lous's Hot air gun I hope tomorrow.  Anyway,  I have 2 of these boards and business is slow on the break fix side so I am teaching myself troubleshooting with all your help,  Well,  mostly Duke in the past.  I figured since there was no power to start with <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?  Based on Schematics I am getting good voltages on pin 12, 19 and 20...  Suggestions from here welcomed please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, no power,no charge liquid damage
threads.message: PPBUS, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, PP3V42? Green light present? Using a REAL GENUINE 85W charger, no Amazon or Chinese crap!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light, no power,no charge liquid damage
threads.message: Duke, trying to catch up to have some time to work on the board, just got the Weller hot air station... more soon I hope
